name: Coca-Cola European Partners
goal:
CCEP is the world’s largest independent Coca-Cola bottler, serving Belgium, continental France, Germany, Great-Britain, Iceland, Luxembourg, Monaco, the Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Spain and Sweden.

Brands of The Coca-Cola Company represented more than 90% of our bottle and cans volume in 2013, with other brands such as Monster and Capri-Sun accounting for the balance.

24.500 employees
2016 revenues of Euro 9,1 billion
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Enterprise, Environment, Food Safety, Internal Market, Public Health, Taxation, Trade, Youth
euInitiatives:
CCEP follows all EU public policies and legislation in the fields of interests listed below, but activities under the scope of the Register primarily covered the following EU initiatives:

Agriculture and rural development:
European CAP reform, particularly the EU’s sugar policy

Trade:
PET trade remedies

Environment:
Review of waste policy and legislation, particularly the Waste Framework Directive and Packaging and Packaging Waste Directive as part of the Circular Economy Package

Climate:
EU 2030 Policy Framework for Climate and Energy

Health:
EU Action Plan on Childhood Obesity
